meanings.definition: A machine or device used to remove moisture or water from something.
meanings.sent1: The dryers in the laundry room quickly dry our clothes.
meanings.sent2: She put the wet towel in the dryer to make it dry faster.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot thought the dryer was a giant bird trying to steal its water.
meanings.sent4: The sun acted like a giant dryer, drying up all the rain puddles on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the dryer made it seem like a hungry monster gobbling up the wet clothes.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that dries something.
meanings.sent1: The sun is a natural dryer for our wet swimsuits.
meanings.sent2: The hair dryer helped her dry her hair quickly before going out.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was to be a human dryer, instantly drying anything he touched.
meanings.sent4: The wind acted as a giant dryer, blowing away the rain clouds from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The desert was like a massive dryer, turning the wet sand into dry dunes.

meanings.definition: A substance or chemical used to speed up the drying process.
meanings.sent1: The fabric softener also acts as a dryer, reducing drying time.
meanings.sent2: The paint thinner served as a dryer, helping the paint dry faster.
meanings.sent3: The magician's potion was a magical dryer, making wet things instantly dry.
meanings.sent4: The heat from the fire acted as a natural dryer, drying the wet paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The hair spray contained a special dryer that set the hairstyle in place.
